    • Constructor Detail

      • StringPane

        public StringPane(java.lang.String overlay)
        creates a layered pane to allow internal and external border styles and sizes. Styled by default to look like VaSOLSim's bounding boxes
        Parameters:
        overlay - the string in the box

      • StringPane

        public StringPane(java.lang.String overlay,
          int width,
          int height,
          int inset)
        creates a layered pane to allow internal and external border styles and sizes. Styled by default to look like VaSOLSim's bounding boxes
        Parameters:
        overlay - the string in the box
        width - the width of the box
        height - the height of the box
        inset - the inset between the external and internal panes

      • StringPane

        public StringPane(java.lang.String overlay,
          java.lang.String styleClass,
          java.lang.String subStyleClass,
          java.lang.String subStyleActiveClass,
          java.lang.String textStyleClass,
          int width,
          int height,
          int inset)
        creates a layered pane to allow internal and external border styles and sizes
        Parameters:
        overlay - the string in the box
        styleClass - the style formatting the external border (transparent bg and some other style)
        subStyleClass - the style formatting the internal pane
        subStyleActiveClass - the style formatting the internal pane when it is active (does not layer with subStyleClass)
        textStyleClass - the style formatting the text
        width - the width of the box
        height - the height of the box
        inset - the inset between the external and internal panes

    • Method Detail

      • getActiveProperty

        public BooleanProperty getActiveProperty()
        the active state is bound by BooleanProperty and is accessible to attach listeners
        Returns:
        active property

      • setOverlay

        public void setOverlay(java.lang.String overlay)
        sets the text of the StringPane
        Parameters:
        overlay - text

      • getOverlay

        public java.lang.String getOverlay()
        gets the text of the StringPane
        Returns:
        text
